H0.text: Erosion is the process by which jagged mountains most likely become rounded hills.

H1.text: Deposition is the process through which jagged mountains would most likely become rounded hills.

H2.text: Volcanic activity is the process that would most likely transform jagged mountains into rounded hills.

H3.text: Chemical change is the process that would most likely transform jagged mountains into rounded hills.

A4.text: glacial erosion controls the maximum height of mountains, as the relief between mountain peaks and the snow line are generally confined to altitudes less than 1500 m.

A5.text: The erosion caused by glaciers worldwide erodes mountains so effectively that the term glacial buzzsaw has become widely used, which describes the limiting effect of glaciers on the height of mountain ranges.
